what: Causal Effects in Principal Strata Defined by Antidrug Antibodies
title: Causal Effects in Principal Strata Defined by Antidrug Antibodies
text: Bayesian models estimate causal effects biological treatments time--event endpoints clinical trials principal strata defined occurrence antidrug antibodies.

title: Causal Effects in Principal Strata Defined by Antidrug Antibodies
text: package contains functions fit Bayesian principal stratification models perform clinical trial simulations determine operating characteristics given scenarios. intercurrent event (determining principal stratum interest) can occur treated arm (development antidrug antibodies), time--event endpoint assumed follow exponential distribution. Effect estimators hazard ratios restricted mean survival times. Potential predictors intercurrent event can taken account. models fitted Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) sampling, coded Stan precompiled. flexible time--event distributions (piecewise-exponential Weibull) considered future versions package.

title: Causal Effects in Principal Strata Defined by Antidrug Antibodies
text: Principal stratification approach estimate causal effects partitions subjects determined post-treatment events. introduced biostatistical literature Frangakis Rubin (2002). ICH E9 (R1) addendum estimands sensitivity analysis clinical trials proposed principal stratification one approach deal intercurrent events clinical trials (International Council Harmonisation (ICH) (2020)). Principal stratum membership typically known certainty. Bayesian approach may particularly suited deal type uncertainty. Following proposal Imbens Rubin (1997), principal stratum membership can treated latent mixture variable. Motivated scientific questions arising clinical trials biological therapies, package approach Imbens Rubin (1997) adapted specific clinical trial setting time--event endpoint intercurrent event occurring treated group. recent reviews applications clinical trials see Lipkovich et al. (2022) Bornkamp et al. (2021). References:

title: Causal Effects in Principal Strata Defined by Antidrug Antibodies

code: install.packages("BPrinStratTTE") if (!require("remotes")) {install.packages("remotes")} remotes::install_github("Boehringer-Ingelheim/BPrinStratTTE")

title: The 'BPrinStratTTE' package. — BPrinStratTTE-package
text: Bayesian models estimate causal effects biological treatments time--event endpoints clinical trials principal strata defined occurrence antidrug antibodies. methodology based Frangakis Rubin (2002) doi:10.1111/j.0006-341x.2002.00021.x Imbens Rubin (1997) doi:10.1214/aos/1034276631, intended applied specific time--event setting.#'

title: The 'BPrinStratTTE' package. — BPrinStratTTE-package
text: Stan Development Team (2022). RStan: R interface Stan. R package version 2.21.5. https://mc-stan.org

what: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_covar
title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_covar
text: Fit multiple models data two-arm trials exponentially distributed time--event endpoint one predictor intercurrent event

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_covar
code: fit_mult_exp_covar(dat_mult_trials, params, seed = 23)

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_covar
text: dat_mult_trials List generated sim_dat_mult_trials_exp_covar. params List model parameters supplied fit_single_exp_covar. seed Numeric value, seed reproducibility.

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_covar
text: list objects generated fit_single_exp_covar.

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_covar
code: d_params_covar <- list(   n = 1000,           nt = 500,          prob_X1 = 0.4,    prob_ice_X1 = 0.5,    prob_ice_X0 = 0.2,   fu_max = 48*7,          T0T_rate = 0.2,        T0N_rate = 0.2,        T1T_rate = 0.15,        T1N_rate = 0.1  ) dat_mult_trials <- sim_dat_mult_trials_exp_covar(   n_iter = 2,   params = d_params_covar  ) m_params_covar <- list(   tg = 48,   p = 2,    prior_delta = matrix(     c(0, 5, 0, 5),     nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2,   n_iter = 3000,   warmup = 1500,   cores = 2,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = TRUE ) # \donttest{ fit_multiple <- fit_mult_exp_covar(   dat_mult_trials = dat_mult_trials,   params = m_params_covar,   seed = 12 ) lapply(fit_multiple, dim) head(fit_multiple[[1]]) # }

what: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_nocovar
title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_nocovar
text: Fit multiple models data two-arm trials exponentially distributed time--event endpoint predictor intercurrent event

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_nocovar
code: fit_mult_exp_nocovar(dat_mult_trials, params, seed = 23)

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_nocovar
text: dat_mult_trials List generated sim_dat_mult_trials_exp_nocovar. params List model parameters supplied fit_single_exp_nocovar. seed Numeric value, seed reproducibility.

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_nocovar
text: list objects generated fit_single_exp_nocovar.

title: Fit multiple models to data from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_mult_exp_nocovar
code: d_params_nocovar <- list(   n = 500L,   nt = 250L,   prob_ice = 0.5,   fu_max = 336L,   T0T_rate = 0.2,   T0N_rate = 0.2,   T1T_rate = 0.15,   T1N_rate = 0.1 ) dat_mult_trials <- sim_dat_mult_trials_exp_nocovar(   n_iter = 2,   params = d_params_nocovar  ) m_params_nocovar <- list(   tg = 48L,   prior_piT = c(0.5, 0.5),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2L,   n_iter = 3000L,   warmup = 1500L,   cores = 2L,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = TRUE ) # \donttest{ fit_multiple <- fit_mult_exp_nocovar(   dat_mult_trials = dat_mult_trials,   params = m_params_nocovar,   seed = 12 ) lapply(fit_multiple, dim) head(fit_multiple[[1]]) # }

what: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
text: Fit single model data two-arm trial exponentially distributed time--event endpoint one predictor intercurrent event

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
code: fit_single_exp_covar(data, params, summarize_fit = TRUE)

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
text: data Data frame structure generated sim_dat_one_trial_exp_covar(). params List, containing model parameters: tg Positive integer value, number intervals calculate restricted mean survival time using trapezoidal rule. p  Positive integer value, number predictors intercurrent event interest (.e. event determines. principal stratum membership). prior_delta  px2 matrix positive numerical values, containing normal priors (mean standard deviation) model parameter delta. prior_0N Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_0N. prior_1N Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_1N. prior_0T Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_0T. prior_1T Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_1T. t_grid Numeric vector length tg, containing time points defining time grid (months) calculate restricted mean survival time using trapezoidal rule. chains Positive integer value, specifying number Markov chains. n_iter Positive integer value, specifying number iterations chain (including warmup). warmup Positive integer value, specifying number warmup (aka burnin) iterations per chain. cores Positive integer value, specifying number cores use executing chains parallel. open_progress Logical value, indicating whether progress chains redirected file automatically opened inspection. show_messages Logical value, indicating whether print summary informational messages. summarize_fit Logical, TRUE (default), output restricted summary results key parameters chains, FALSE, complete stanfit object returned.

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
text: tibble() containing summary results key parameters, stanfit object (S4 class), depending summarize_fit.

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
text: data supplied params used either priors (prior_delta, prior_0N, prior_1N, prior_1T), inform model setup (tg, p, t_grid), parameters rstan::sampling() invoked internally (chains, n_iter, warmup, cores, open_progress, show_messages).

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_covar
code: d_params_covar <- list(   n = 1000,           nt = 500,          prob_X1 = 0.4,    prob_ice_X1 = 0.5,    prob_ice_X0 = 0.2,   fu_max = 48*7,          T0T_rate = 0.2,        T0N_rate = 0.2,        T1T_rate = 0.15,        T1N_rate = 0.1  ) dat_single_trial <- sim_dat_one_trial_exp_covar(   n = d_params_covar[["n"]],    nt = d_params_covar[["nt"]],   prob_X1 = d_params_covar[["prob_X1"]],   prob_ice_X1 = d_params_covar[["prob_ice_X1"]],   prob_ice_X0 = d_params_covar[["prob_ice_X0"]],   fu_max = d_params_covar[["fu_max"]],     T0T_rate = d_params_covar[["T0T_rate"]],   T0N_rate = d_params_covar[["T0N_rate"]],   T1T_rate = d_params_covar[["T1T_rate"]],   T1N_rate = d_params_covar[["T1N_rate"]]  ) m_params_covar <- list(   tg = 48,   p = 2,    prior_delta = matrix(     c(0, 5, 0, 5),     nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2,   n_iter = 3000,   warmup = 1500,   cores = 2,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = FALSE    ) # \donttest{ fit_single <- fit_single_exp_covar(   data = dat_single_trial,   params = m_params_covar,   summarize_fit = FALSE ) print(fit_single)  # }

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_nocovar
code: fit_single_exp_nocovar(data, params, summarize_fit = TRUE)

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_nocovar
text: data Data frame structure generated sim_dat_one_trial_exp_nocovar(). params List, containing model parameters: tg Positive integer value, number intervals calculate restricted mean survival time using trapezoidal rule. prior_piT Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) beta prior pi, indicating probability belonging stratum subjects developing intercurrent event given treatment. prior_0N Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_0N. prior_1N Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_1N. prior_0T Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_0T. prior_1T Numeric vector length 2, containing parameters (alpha, beta) gamma prior lambda_1T. t_grid Numeric vector length tg, containing time points defining time grid (months) calculate restricted mean survival time using trapezoidal rule. chains Positive integer value, specifying number Markov chains. n_iter Positive integer value, specifying number iterations chain (including warmup). warmup Positive integer value, specifying number warmup (aka burnin) iterations per chain. cores Positive integer value, specifying number cores use executing chains parallel. open_progress Logical value, indicating whether progress chains redirected file automatically opened inspection. show_messages Logical value, indicating whether print summary informational messages. summarize_fit Logical, TRUE (default), output restricted summary results key parameters chains, FALSE, complete stanfit object returned.

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_nocovar
text: tibble() containing summary results key parameters, stanfit object, depending summarize_fit.

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_nocovar
text: data supplied params used either priors (prior_delta, prior_0N, prior_1N, prior_1T), inform model setup (tg, p, t_grid), parameters rstan::sampling() invoked internally (chains, n_iter, warmup, cores, open_progress, show_messages).

title: Fit single model to data from a two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — fit_single_exp_nocovar
code: d_params_nocovar <- list(   n = 500L,   nt = 250L,   prob_ice = 0.5,   fu_max = 336L,   T0T_rate = 0.2,   T0N_rate = 0.2,   T1T_rate = 0.15,   T1N_rate = 0.1 ) dat_single_trial <- sim_dat_one_trial_exp_nocovar(   n = d_params_nocovar[["n"]],    nt = d_params_nocovar[["nt"]],   prob_ice = d_params_nocovar[["prob_ice"]],   fu_max = d_params_nocovar[["fu_max"]],     T0T_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T0T_rate"]],   T0N_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T0N_rate"]],   T1T_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T1T_rate"]],   T1N_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T1N_rate"]]  ) m_params_nocovar <- list(   tg = 48L,   prior_piT = c(0.5, 0.5),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2L,   n_iter = 3000L,   warmup = 1500L,   cores = 2L,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = TRUE ) # \donttest{ fit_single <- fit_single_exp_nocovar(   data = dat_single_trial,   params = m_params_nocovar,   summarize_fit = TRUE ) print(fit_single) # }

title: Inverse logit function — inv_logit
text: Inverse logit function

title: Inverse logit function — inv_logit
code: inv_logit(x)

title: Inverse logit function — inv_logit
text: x Numeric value  (usually logarithm odds).

title: Inverse logit function — inv_logit
text: Numeric value interval \([0,1]\), result log(pi/(1-pi)). Numeric value, result exp(x)/(1+exp(x)).

title: Inverse logit function — inv_logit
text: inverse logit function also known logistic function.

title: Inverse logit function — inv_logit
code: # probabilities  prob_ICE_base <- 0.3 prob_ICE_risk <- 0.6 # model coefficients (beta1 <- logit(prob_ICE_base)) (beta2 <- logit(prob_ICE_risk) - logit(prob_ICE_base)) # linear predictor  logit(prob_ICE_base); (lin_pred1 <- beta1 + beta2*0) logit(prob_ICE_risk); (lin_pred2 <- beta1 + beta2*1) # inverse logit of linear predictor  (inv_logit(lin_pred1)) # prob for X1 = 0 (inv_logit(lin_pred2)) # prob for X1 = 1

code: logit(pi)

title: Logit function — logit
text: Numeric value, result log(pi/(1-pi)).

title: Logit function — logit
code: # probabilities  prob_ICE_base <- 0.3 prob_ICE_risk <- 0.6 # model coefficients (beta1 <- logit(prob_ICE_base)) (beta2 <- logit(prob_ICE_risk) - logit(prob_ICE_base)) # linear predictor  logit(prob_ICE_base); (lin_pred1 <- beta1 + beta2*0) logit(prob_ICE_risk); (lin_pred2 <- beta1 + beta2*1) # inverse logit of linear predictor  (inv_logit(lin_pred1)) # prob for X1 = 0 (inv_logit(lin_pred2)) # prob for X1 = 1

title: Determine operating characteristics of fits from two-arm trials with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — ocs_exp_covar
code: d_params_covar <- list(   n = 1000,           nt = 500,          prob_X1 = 0.4,    prob_ice_X1 = 0.5,    prob_ice_X0 = 0.2,   fu_max = 48*7,          T0T_rate = 0.2,        T0N_rate = 0.2,        T1T_rate = 0.15,        T1N_rate = 0.1  ) dat_mult_trials <- sim_dat_mult_trials_exp_covar(   n_iter = 2,   params = d_params_covar  ) m_params_covar <- list(   tg = 48,   p = 2,    prior_delta = matrix(     c(0, 5, 0, 5),     nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2,   n_iter = 3000,   warmup = 1500,   cores = 2,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = TRUE ) # \donttest{ fit_multiple <- fit_mult_exp_covar(   dat_mult_trials = dat_mult_trials,   params = m_params_covar,   seed = 12 ) list_ocs <- ocs_exp_covar(   multiple_fits = fit_multiple,    d_params = d_params_covar,    m_params = m_params_covar ) print(list_ocs) # }

code: sim_dat_one_trial_exp_covar(   n,   nt,   prob_X1,   prob_ice_X1,   prob_ice_X0,   fu_max,   T0T_rate,   T0N_rate,   T1T_rate,   T1N_rate )

title: Simulate data from a single two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and one predictor of the intercurrent event — sim_dat_one_trial_exp_covar
text: n Positive integer value, number subjects trial. nt Positive integer value, number treated subjects. prob_X1 Numeric value interval \((0,1)\), probability high risk experiencing intercurrent event interest treated (.e. event determines principal stratum membership). prob_ice_X1 Numeric value interval \((0,1)\), probability intercurrent event interest treated high risk intercurrent event. prob_ice_X0 Numeric value interval \((0,1)\), probability intercurrent event interest treated high risk intercurrent event. fu_max Positive integer value, maximum follow-time days (administrative censoring assumed afterwards). T0T_rate Positive numeric value, monthly event rate control subjects develop intercurrent event treated. T0N_rate Positive numeric value, monthly event rate control subjects never develop intercurrent event. T1T_rate Positive numeric value, monthly event rate treated subjects develop intercurrent event. T1N_rate Positive numeric value, monthly event rate treated subjects never develop intercurrent event.

title: Simulate data from a single two-arm trial with an exponentially distributed time-to-event endpoint and no predictor of the intercurrent event — sim_dat_one_trial_exp_nocovar
code: d_params_nocovar <- list(   n = 500L,   nt = 250L,   prob_ice = 0.5,   fu_max = 336L,   T0T_rate = 0.2,   T0N_rate = 0.2,   T1T_rate = 0.15,   T1N_rate = 0.1 ) dat_single_trial <- sim_dat_one_trial_exp_nocovar(   n = d_params_nocovar[["n"]],    nt = d_params_nocovar[["nt"]],   prob_ice = d_params_nocovar[["prob_ice"]],   fu_max = d_params_nocovar[["fu_max"]],     T0T_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T0T_rate"]],   T0N_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T0N_rate"]],   T1T_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T1T_rate"]],   T1N_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T1N_rate"]]  ) dim(dat_single_trial) head(dat_single_trial)

title: Adding true values to estimates for models with an exponential endpoint and consideration of predictors of the intercurrent event — true_vals_exp_covar
code: d_params_covar <- list(   n = 1000,           nt = 500,          prob_X1 = 0.4,    prob_ice_X1 = 0.5,    prob_ice_X0 = 0.2,   fu_max = 48*7,          T0T_rate = 0.2,        T0N_rate = 0.2,        T1T_rate = 0.15,        T1N_rate = 0.1  ) dat_single_trial <- sim_dat_one_trial_exp_covar(   n = d_params_covar[["n"]],    nt = d_params_covar[["nt"]],   prob_X1 = d_params_covar[["prob_X1"]],   prob_ice_X1 = d_params_covar[["prob_ice_X1"]],   prob_ice_X0 = d_params_covar[["prob_ice_X0"]],   fu_max = d_params_covar[["fu_max"]],     T0T_rate = d_params_covar[["T0T_rate"]],   T0N_rate = d_params_covar[["T0N_rate"]],   T1T_rate = d_params_covar[["T1T_rate"]],   T1N_rate = d_params_covar[["T1N_rate"]]  ) m_params_covar <- list(   tg = 48,   p = 2,    prior_delta = matrix(     c(0, 5, 0, 5),     nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2,   n_iter = 3000,   warmup = 1500,   cores = 2,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = TRUE    ) # \donttest{ fit_single <- fit_single_exp_covar(   data = dat_single_trial,   params = m_params_covar,   summarize_fit = TRUE ) print(fit_single) tab_obs_truth <- true_vals_exp_covar(   x = fit_single,   d_params = d_params_covar,   m_params = m_params_covar ) print(tab_obs_truth) # }

title: Adding true values to estimates for models with an exponential endpoint and no consideration of predictors of the intercurrent event — true_vals_exp_nocovar
code: d_params_nocovar <- list(   n = 500L,   nt = 250L,   prob_ice = 0.5,   fu_max = 336L,   T0T_rate = 0.2,   T0N_rate = 0.2,   T1T_rate = 0.15,   T1N_rate = 0.1 ) dat_single_trial <- sim_dat_one_trial_exp_nocovar(   n = d_params_nocovar[["n"]],    nt = d_params_nocovar[["nt"]],   prob_ice = d_params_nocovar[["prob_ice"]],   fu_max = d_params_nocovar[["fu_max"]],     T0T_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T0T_rate"]],   T0N_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T0N_rate"]],   T1T_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T1T_rate"]],   T1N_rate = d_params_nocovar[["T1N_rate"]]  ) m_params_nocovar <- list(   tg = 48L,   prior_piT = c(0.5, 0.5),   prior_0N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1N = c(1.5, 5),   prior_0T = c(1.5, 5),   prior_1T = c(1.5, 5),   t_grid =  seq(7, 7 * 48, 7) / 30,   chains = 2L,   n_iter = 3000L,   warmup = 1500L,   cores = 2L,   open_progress = FALSE,   show_messages = TRUE   ) # \donttest{ fit_single <- fit_single_exp_nocovar(   data = dat_single_trial,   params = m_params_nocovar,   summarize_fit = TRUE  ) print(fit_single)  tab_obs_truth <- true_vals_exp_nocovar(   x = fit_single,   d_params = d_params_nocovar,   m_params = m_params_nocovar ) print(tab_obs_truth) # }
